subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: In {{w|Chinese character|Chinese}}, {{w|Hanja|Korean}} and {{w|Chữ Nôm|Vietnamese}} scripts, the right side component is written [[每]] (contains [[母]] with 2 dots). In Japanese {{w|shinjitai}}, the component is simplified to [[毎]] (contains [[毋]] with a single middle stroke). Due to {{w|Han unification}}, both characters ({{lang|und|sc=Hani|梅}}/{{lang|ja|梅}}) are encoded under the same Unicode codepoint. A CJK {{w|CJK compatibility ideographs|compatibility ideograph}} (U+FA44) exists for the {{w|kyūjitai}} form of {{lang|ja|梅}}.
